headline: Qnity Announces Segment Leadership Transition
summary: WILMINGTON, Del., December 09, 2025--Qnity Electronics, Inc. ("Qnity") (NYSE: Q), a premier technology solutions leader across the semiconductor value chain, today announced that it has appointed Sam Ponzo as Interim President of its Semiconductor Technologies segment, effective immediately. Sam’s appointment follows a mutual decision between the Company and Sang Ho Kang that he would depart from this position.

Sam’s appointment follows a mutual decision between the Company and Sang Ho Kang that he would depart from this position.

headline: Assessing DuPont (DD) Valuation After Recent Share Price Drift and Cooling Investor Sentiment
summary: DuPont de Nemours (DD) has quietly drifted lower over the past 3 months even as its one year total return remains solidly positive, which sets up an interesting reset for long term investors. See our latest analysis for DuPont de Nemours. After a sharp slide in the last quarter, DuPont de Nemours’ recent 1 month share price return has stabilised, while its multi year total shareholder return remains firmly positive. This hints that sentiment has cooled more than the long term story has...

headline: How Is DuPont de Nemours Stock Performance Compared to Other Materials Stocks?
summary: DuPont stock has outperformed other materials stocks over the past year, and analysts remain optimistic about its prospects.

headline: Bioadhesives Market Set to Hit USD 14.60 Billion by 2029
summary: The bioadhesives market is projected to grow to USD 14.60 billion by 2029, increasing at a CAGR of 8.6% from USD 9.65 billion in 2024. This growth is driven by rising demand for eco-friendly adhesives in industries such as construction, woodworking, and medical applications. Europe is set to lead, with Germany experiencing the fastest growth due to its robust infrastructure and focus on sustainability. Asia Pacific follows, with strong demand in paper & packaging and medical sectors. Key players

headline: Moat Stocks Gain On Health Care Strength, Tech Slowdown
summary:
Moat Index gained 1.53% in November, supported by health care and broader market participation.
Merck and Amgen were top Moat Index contributors, benefiting from strong demand and pipelines.
